meanings.definition: To steer a vehicle in a way that causes the rear wheels to lose traction and the vehicle to turn more sharply than intended.
meanings.sent1: The car oversteers when the driver turns too quickly on a slippery road.
meanings.sent2: He noticed the car oversteers when he tries to make sharp turns at high speeds.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy oversteers around the yard, chasing after its tail.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions oversteer her decisions, leading her to unexpected outcomes.
meanings.sent5: The oversteering truck skidded dangerously around the corner, narrowly avoiding a collision.
